definition: to stop
to stop/to halt/to park (a car)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Blaine stopped to chat with a friend and Guiteau saw his chance.
sentences.chinese: 布莱恩停下来跟一位朋友聊天，吉特奥看到了机会。

sentences.english: Take the medicine down and do not stop to think about it.
sentences.chinese: 把药吞下去，吞的时候不要停下来想它。

sentences.english: She brought up the water, stopping at each landing to get her breath.
sentences.chinese: 她提水上楼，在每个楼梯平台处停下来喘口气。

sentences.english: He bore away to the left, stopping now and again to eat muskeg berries.
sentences.chinese: 他取道向左，时而停下来吃些苔藓浆果。

sentences.english: I threw the brick because no one else would stop.
sentences.chinese: 我丢砖块是因为没有人停下来，小男孩儿声泪俱下。

sentences.english: I shouted to the pedestrians for help, but no one stopped.
sentences.chinese: 我大喊着向行人道上的路人求助，但是没有人停下来。

sentences.english: Stop and visit the medieval castle.
sentences.chinese: 停下来游览这个中世纪的古堡。

sentences.english: On his way to the harvest supper Gabriel stopped to check the eight huge hay-and wheat-ricks.
sentences.chinese: 盖伯瑞尔走在路上，停下来查看那八个麦垛。

sentences.english: The poor pauper paused on purpose to pawn a porpoise.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的乞丐有意停下来典当一只海豚。

sentences.english: No, it's not gonna work this time. Stop it. I'm serious, Boog.
sentences.chinese: 不行，这次不管用了停下来，我是认真的，博格。

sentences.english: At a time when I tired to stop dwelling poetically .
sentences.chinese: 在我疲倦的时候可以停下来诗意地栖居。
马车停下来，他被抓住了。

sentences.english: Stop, breathe for a sec, then sprint again.
sentences.chinese: 停下来，呼吸几秒，然后再冲刺。

sentences.english: Eero stopped suddenly and looked around.
He stopped to talk with me.
He brought up the car at the curb.
sentences.chinese: 他在路缘把汽车急停下来。

definition: to stop
to stop/to halt/to cease
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to come to a stand/to stop
to stand up
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
ahead/the front
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
wait a moment
to halt/to break off/pause (in speech)
rest/to rest
to move forwards
